sentences.en: A coastline of 472 kilometers, multi headland and harbor.
sentences.cn: 海岸线长472公里, 多岬角和港湾.

sentences.en: A steeply projecting mass of rock forming part of a rugged cliff or headland.
sentences.cn: 危崖一组构成部分多岩峭壁或岬的陡峭突兀的石块群.

sentences.en: Australia's most recognizable icon is dramatically situated on the eastern headland of Circular Quay.
sentences.cn: 澳大利亚最容易识别的图标是显着位于东部岬角的环形码头.

sentences.en: Built in 1866 and standing on a headland overlooking the harbor, the building has been beautifully preserved.
sentences.cn: 这个建于1866年的领事馆坐落在岬角上，俯视着海港，至今仍保存完好。

sentences.en: Cape Kazantip is a prominent headland on the Kerch Peninsula, which defines the southern shore of the Sea of Azov and the east extension of the Crimean Peninsula.
sentences.cn: 卡赞提角是刻赤半岛上的一个突出岬角，它界定了亚速海南岸和克里米亚半岛的东延。

sentences.en: Having enjoyed the rides at the Headland, visitors can take the shuttle to the Lowland.
sentences.cn: 游客在高地车乘以后,可以坐穿梭车去低地.

sentences.en: In fact, lie the Americas to work together across the headland to the water bridge.
sentences.cn: 实际上是跨越一道横亘在美洲地岬上的水桥.

sentences.en: In five minutes we were the, and drifting with the most startling rapidity round the headland.
sentences.cn: 五分钟后我们就穿过激浪, 以令人目眩的速度向那个海岬漂过去.

sentences.en: Our road lay by the shore beneath the cliffs, then round the headland which they formed.
sentences.cn: 我们行经断岩下沙岸边的路, 再转绕过山岩形成的山头.

sentences.en: Sea and headland now grew dim.
sentences.cn: 此刻,海面和岬角朦朦胧胧地混为一片了.

sentences.en: She likes to stand on the headland to watch the ships.
sentences.cn: 她喜欢站在海岬上,观看船只.

sentences.en: Sohar passed the headland at Muscat to a chant.
sentences.cn: 在歌声中,“苏哈尔”号越过马斯喀特的陆岬.

sentences.en: Stephen stood at his post, gazing over the calm sea towards the headland.
sentences.cn: 斯蒂芬依然站在原地, 目光越过风平浪静的海洋,朝那岬角望去.

sentences.en: The fleet lay at anchor half a mile off the headland.
sentences.cn: 舰队在离山岬半英里处抛锚停泊.

sentences.en: The headland intercepted the heavy sea that was occasioned by the squall.
sentences.cn: 海岬截断了被风暴搅得发疯的大海.

sentences.en: The patio gave an unimpeded view across the headland to the sea.
sentences.cn: 从阳台望去,视野越过海岬直到大海.

sentences.en: The small ship came around the headland and steamed toward the U - boat.
sentences.cn: 一只小艇绕过海岬,嘟嘟地朝潜水艇开去.

sentences.en: They start as part of a headland or sea cliff connected to land. Smashing waves erode the softer rock, leaving harder rock behind in the form of sea stacks.
sentences.cn: 它们开始时作为岬角和海崖的一部分与陆地相连，海浪粉碎地侵蚀了较为脆弱的岩石，而把较硬的岩石留在所形成海栈的后面。

trans.tran_cn: 向水中突出的陆地，畦头未耕的一条地，岬
trans.tran_en: an area of land that sticks out from the coast into the sea
